Profession.Name: Actor
Profession.Description: A person whose profession is acting on the stage.

Profession.Name: Advocate
Profession.Description: A lawyer in a court of law.

Profession.Name: Alchemist
Profession.Description: A person who practices alchemy.

Profession.Name: Animal Handler
Profession.Description: A person in immediate physical charge of an animal.

Profession.Name: Apothecary
Profession.Description: A person who prepares alchemical items, brews potions, serves as a healer, and occasionally dabbles in poisons on the side if they're into that sort of thing.

Profession.Name: Architect
Profession.Description: A person who designs buildings and in many cases also supervises their construction.

Profession.Name: Archer
Profession.Description: A person who shoots with a bow and arrows.

Profession.Name: Aristocrat
Profession.Description: A person whose family has a high social rank, especially someone who has a title.

Profession.Name: Armorer
Profession.Description: A maker, supplier, or repairer of weapons or armor.

Profession.Name: Artisan
Profession.Description: A worker in a skilled trade.

Profession.Name: Artist
Profession.Description: A person who practices any of the various creative arts.

Profession.Name: Astrologer
Profession.Description: A person who uses astrology to tell others about their character or to predict their future.

Profession.Name: Baker
Profession.Description: A person who makes bread and cakes.

Profession.Name: Banker
Profession.Description: An officer or owner of a bank or group of banks.

Profession.Name: Barbarian
Profession.Description: An archetypal warrior who uses brute strength and raw fury to excel in combat.

Profession.Name: Barber
Profession.Description: A person who cuts hair and shaves or trims beards.

Profession.Name: Bard
Profession.Description: A poet, traditionally one reciting epics and associated with a particular oral tradition.

Profession.Name: Barkeep
Profession.Description: A person who owns and/or serves drinks in a bar.

Profession.Name: Barmaid
Profession.Description: A waitress who serves drinks in a bar.

Profession.Name: Beekeeper
Profession.Description: A person who keeps honey bees.

Profession.Name: Beer Seller
Profession.Description: A person who specializes in the sale and distribution of beer.

Profession.Name: Beggar
Profession.Description: A person, typically a homeless one, who lives by asking for money or food.

Profession.Name: Blacksmith
Profession.Description: A metalsmith who creates objects from wrought iron or steel by forging the metal, using tools to hammer, bend, and cut.

Profession.Name: Boatman
Profession.Description: A person who rents out or works on boats.

Profession.Name: Boatswain
Profession.Description: A ship's officer in charge of equipment and the crew.

Profession.Name: Bookbinder
Profession.Description: A person who binds books.

Profession.Name: Bookseller
Profession.Description: A person who sells books, especially as the owner or manager of a bookstore.

Profession.Name: Bowman
Profession.Description: A person who shoots with a bow and arrows.

Profession.Name: Bowyer
Profession.Description: A person who makes or sells archers' bows.

Profession.Name: Brewer
Profession.Description: A person that manufactures beer.

Profession.Name: Brothel Keeper
Profession.Description: A person who runs a brothel.

Profession.Name: Buckle Maker
Profession.Description: A person who manufactures buckles.

Profession.Name: Builder
Profession.Description: A person who constructs something by putting parts or material together over a period of time.

Profession.Name: Butcher
Profession.Description: A person whose trade is cutting up and selling meat in a shop.

Profession.Name: Caravan Leader
Profession.Description: A person who is the leader of a caravan.

Profession.Name: Carpenter
Profession.Description: A person who makes and repairs wooden objects and structures.

Profession.Name: Cartographer
Profession.Description: A person who draws or produces maps.

Profession.Name: Chandler
Profession.Description: A dealer in supplies and equipment for ships and boats.

Profession.Name: Charioteer
Profession.Description: A chariot driver.

Profession.Name: Chatelaine
Profession.Description: A woman in charge of a large house.

Profession.Name: Chef
Profession.Description: A professional cook, typically the chief cook in an establishment.

Profession.Name: Chieftain
Profession.Description: A person who is the leader of a people or clan.

Profession.Name: Chirurgeon
Profession.Description: An alchemist who studies anatomy and uses this knowledge to heal.

Profession.Name: Clergyman
Profession.Description: A priest, minister, or religious leader

Profession.Name: Clerk
Profession.Description: A person employed in an office or bank to keep records and accounts and to undertake other routine administrative duties.

Profession.Name: Clock Maker
Profession.Description: A person who makes and repairs clocks and watches.

Profession.Name: Cloth Worker
Profession.Description: A textile worker or manufacturer.

Profession.Name: Commander
Profession.Description: A person in authority, especially over a body of troops or a military operation.

Profession.Name: Concubine
Profession.Description: A person, in particular a woman, who engages in sexual activity for payment.

Profession.Name: Cook
Profession.Description: A person who prepares and cooks food.

Profession.Name: Cooper
Profession.Description: A maker or repairer of casks and barrels.

Profession.Name: Copyist
Profession.Description: A person who makes copies, especially of handwritten documents or music.

Profession.Name: Counselor
Profession.Description: A person trained to give guidance on personal, social, or psychological problems.

Profession.Name: Courtesan
Profession.Description: A concubine, especially one with wealthy or upper-class clients.

Profession.Name: Courtier
Profession.Description: A person who attends a royal court as a companion or adviser to the king or queen.

Profession.Name: Cowherd
Profession.Description: A person who tends grazing cattle.

Profession.Name: Crossbowman
Profession.Description: A person who shoots with a crossbow and bolts.

Profession.Name: Cutler
Profession.Description: A person who makes or sells cutlery.

Profession.Name: Daimyo
Profession.Description: A person who is a high-ranked, powerful lord.

Profession.Name: Dairymaid
Profession.Description: A woman employed in a dairy.

Profession.Name: Diplomat
Profession.Description: An official representing a country abroad.

Profession.Name: Distiller
Profession.Description: A person that manufactures liquor.

Profession.Name: Diver
Profession.Description: A person who works under water.

Profession.Name: Diviner
Profession.Description: A type of mage who specialized in divination magics.

Profession.Name: Domestic Servant
Profession.Description: A person who works within the employer's household.

Profession.Name: Emperor/Empress
Profession.Description: A sovereign ruler of great power and rank, especially one ruling an empire.

Profession.Name: Eunuch
Profession.Description: A man who has been castrated.

Profession.Name: Explorer
Profession.Description: A person who explores an unfamiliar area

Profession.Name: Farmer
Profession.Description: A person who owns or manages a farm.

Profession.Name: Fighter
Profession.Description: A person that fights as a boxer.

Profession.Name: Fisherman
Profession.Description: A person who catches fish.

Profession.Name: Fishmonger
Profession.Description: A person that sells fish for food.

Profession.Name: Fletcher
Profession.Description: A person who makes and sells arrows.

Profession.Name: Footman
Profession.Description: A soldier in the infantry.

Profession.Name: Forester
Profession.Description: A person in charge of a forest or skilled in planting, managing, or caring for trees.

Profession.Name: Freighter
Profession.Description: A ship designed to carry goods in bulk.

Profession.Name: Furrier
Profession.Description: A person who prepares or deals in furs.

Profession.Name: Galley Slave
Profession.Description: A person condemned to row in a galley.

Profession.Name: Gambler
Profession.Description: A person who gambles.

Profession.Name: Gardener
Profession.Description: A person who tends and cultivates a garden.

Profession.Name: Geisha
Profession.Description: A hostess trained to entertain men with conversation, dance, and song.

Profession.Name: Gladiator
Profession.Description: A person trained to fight with weapons against other gladiators or wild animals in an arena.

Profession.Name: Glove Maker
Profession.Description: A person who makes gloves.

Profession.Name: Groom
Profession.Description: A person employed to take care of horses.

Profession.Name: Guild Master
Profession.Description: A member of a guild.

Profession.Name: Harness Maker
Profession.Description: A maker of harnesses and similar equipment for horses.

Profession.Name: Hat Maker
Profession.Description: A person who makes hats.

Profession.Name: Hay Merchant
Profession.Description: A person who specializes in the sale and distribution of Hay.

Profession.Name: Healer
Profession.Description: A person who claims to be able to cure a disease or injury using special powers.

Profession.Name: Hearthwitch
Profession.Description: A witch who works around a fireplace.

Profession.Name: Herald
Profession.Description: An official messenger bringing news.

Profession.Name: Herbalist
Profession.Description: A person who makes and sells medicinal herbs.

Profession.Name: Herder
Profession.Description: A person who looks after a herd of livestock or makes a living from keeping livestock, especially in open country.

Profession.Name: Hermit
Profession.Description: A person living in solitude as a religious discipline.

Profession.Name: Highwayman
Profession.Description: Any person living in solitude or seeking to do so.

Profession.Name: Hunter
Profession.Description: A person that hunts.

Profession.Name: Illuminator
Profession.Description: A person who paints manuscripts, books, etc., with designs in color, gold, or the like.

Profession.Name: Innkeeper
Profession.Description: A person who runs an inn.

Profession.Name: Interpreter
Profession.Description: A person who interprets, especially one who translates speech orally.

Profession.Name: Inventor
Profession.Description: A person who invented a particular process or device or who invents things.

Profession.Name: Jailer
Profession.Description: A person in charge of a jail or of the prisoners in it.

Profession.Name: Jester
Profession.Description: A professional joker or “fool” at a court, typically wearing a cap with bells on it and carrying a mock scepter.

Profession.Name: Jeweler
Profession.Description: A person that makes or sells jewels or jewelry.

Profession.Name: Jongleur
Profession.Description: A person who is an itinerant minstrel.

Profession.Name: Judge
Profession.Description: A public official appointed to decide cases in a court of law.

Profession.Name: King
Profession.Description: A male ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.

Profession.Name: Knight
Profession.Description: A warrior who pledges service to rulers, religious orders, and noble causes.

Profession.Name: Laborer
Profession.Description: A person doing unskilled manual work for wages.

Profession.Name: Lady
Profession.Description: A woman of superior social position, especially one of noble birth.

Profession.Name: Lady in Waiting
Profession.Description: A woman who attends a queen or princess.

Profession.Name: Leather Worker
Profession.Description: A person who works in leather

Profession.Name: Limner
Profession.Description: A painter, especially of portraits or miniatures.

Profession.Name: Locksmith
Profession.Description: A person who makes and repairs locks.

Profession.Name: Lord
Profession.Description: a superior, especially the proprietor of a manor house.

Profession.Name: Maidservant
Profession.Description: A female domestic servant.

Profession.Name: Majordomo
Profession.Description: A person who serves as the chief steward of a large household.

Profession.Name: Man at Arms
Profession.Description: A soldier, especially one heavily armed.

Profession.Name: Mason
Profession.Description: A builder and worker in stone.

Profession.Name: Masseur
Profession.Description: A person, especially a man, who provides massages professionally.

Profession.Name: Mercer
Profession.Description: A dealer in textile fabrics, especially silks, velvets, and other fine materials.

Profession.Name: Merchant
Profession.Description: A person involved in wholesale trade, especially one dealing with foreign countries or supplying merchandise to a particular trade.

Profession.Name: Messenger
Profession.Description: A person who carries a message or is employed to carry messages.

Profession.Name: Midwife
Profession.Description: A person, typically a woman, trained to assist women in childbirth.

Profession.Name: Miller
Profession.Description: A person who owns or works in a grain mill.

Profession.Name: Miner
Profession.Description: A person who works in a mine.

Profession.Name: Minstrel
Profession.Description: A medieval singer or musician, especially one who sang or recited lyric or heroic poetry to a musical accompaniment for the nobility.

Profession.Name: Monk
Profession.Description: A member of a religious community of men typically living under vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience.

Profession.Name: Mortician
Profession.Description: A person whose business is preparing dead bodies for burial or cremation and making arrangements for funerals.

Profession.Name: Mourner
Profession.Description: A person who attends a funeral as a relative or friend of the dead person.

Profession.Name: Navigator
Profession.Description: A person who directs the route or course of a ship or other form of transportation, especially by using instruments and maps.

Profession.Name: Necromancer
Profession.Description: A person who practices necromancy.

Profession.Name: Noble
Profession.Description: A person of noble rank or birth.

Profession.Name: Nun
Profession.Description: A member of a religious community of women, especially a cloistered one, living under vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience.

Profession.Name: Nurse
Profession.Description: A person trained to care for the sick or infirm, especially in a hospital.

Profession.Name: Page
Profession.Description: A youth being trained for the rank of knight and in the personal service of a knight.

Profession.Name: Painter
Profession.Description: An artist who paints pictures.

Profession.Name: Pariah
Profession.Description: An outcast.

Profession.Name: Pastry Cook
Profession.Description: A professional cook who specializes in making desserts, especially cakes and pastries.

Profession.Name: Peasant
Profession.Description: A poor farmer of low social status who owns or rents a small piece of land for cultivation.

Profession.Name: Perfumer
Profession.Description: A producer or seller of perfumes.

Profession.Name: Philosopher
Profession.Description: A person engaged or learned in philosophy, especially as an academic discipline.

Profession.Name: Physician
Profession.Description: A person who specializes in healing.

Profession.Name: Pigkeeper
Profession.Description: A person who keeps pigs.

Profession.Name: Pilgrim
Profession.Description: A person who journeys to a sacred place for religious reasons.

Profession.Name: Plasterer
Profession.Description: A person whose job it is to apply plaster to walls, ceilings, or other surfaces.

Profession.Name: Potter
Profession.Description: A person who makes pottery.

Profession.Name: Priest/ess
Profession.Description: An ordained minister that brings the teachings of their gods to the common folk.

Profession.Name: Prince/ss
Profession.Description: A child of a monarch and sometimes the royal ruler of a small state.

Profession.Name: Professor
Profession.Description: A teacher of the highest rank in a college or university.

Profession.Name: Purse Maker
Profession.Description: A person who makes handbags and/or satchels.

Profession.Name: Quartermaster
Profession.Description: A military officer responsible for providing quarters, rations, clothing, and other supplies.

Profession.Name: Queen
Profession.Description: A female ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.

Profession.Name: Ranger
Profession.Description: A keeper of a park, forest, or area of countryside.

Profession.Name: Ratcatcher
Profession.Description: A person or animal employed in exterminating rats.

Profession.Name: Rigger
Profession.Description: A person who rigs or attends to the rigging of a sailing ship.

Profession.Name: Ronin
Profession.Description: A wandering samurai who had no lord or master.

Profession.Name: Roofer
Profession.Description: A person who constructs or repairs roofs.

Profession.Name: Rope Maker
Profession.Description: A craftsman who makes ropes.

Profession.Name: Royal Adviser
Profession.Description: A person who serves as an advisor to a royal family.

Profession.Name: Rug Maker
Profession.Description: A craftsman who makes rugs.

Profession.Name: Ruler
Profession.Description: A person exercising government or dominion.

Profession.Name: Sailor
Profession.Description: A person whose job it is to work as a member of the crew of a commercial or naval ship or boat, especially one who is below the rank of officer.

Profession.Name: Samurai
Profession.Description: A member of a powerful military caste, especially a member of the class of military retainers of the daimyos.

Profession.Name: Scabbard Maker
Profession.Description: A craftsman who makes sheaths for holding a sword, knife, or other large blade.

Profession.Name: Scribe
Profession.Description: A person who copies out documents, especially one employed to do this before printing was invented.

Profession.Name: Sculptor
Profession.Description: An artist who makes sculptures.

Profession.Name: Saddler
Profession.Description: A person who makes, repairs, or deals in saddlery.

Profession.Name: Scavenger
Profession.Description: A person who searches for and collects discarded items.

Profession.Name: Scholar
Profession.Description: A specialist in a particular branch of study, especially the humanities.

Profession.Name: Scrivener
Profession.Description: A clerk, scribe, or notary.

Profession.Name: Servant
Profession.Description: A person who performs duties for others, especially a person employed in a house on domestic duties or as a personal attendant.

Profession.Name: Shaman
Profession.Description: A person regarded as having access to, and influence in, the world of good and evil spirits. Typically such people enter a trance state during a ritual, and practice divination and healing.

Profession.Name: Shepherd
Profession.Description: A person who tends and rears sheep.

Profession.Name: Ship’s Captain
Profession.Description: A high-ranking mariner in ultimate command of a merchant vessel.

Profession.Name: Ship’s Mate
Profession.Description: A member and head of the deck department of a merchant ship.

Profession.Name: Shipwright
Profession.Description: A person or company whose job or business is the design and construction of ships.

Profession.Name: Shoemaker
Profession.Description: A person who makes shoes and other footwear.

Profession.Name: Silversmith
Profession.Description: A person who makes silver articles.

Profession.Name: Slave
Profession.Description: A person who is the legal property of another and is forced to obey them.

Profession.Name: Slaver
Profession.Description: A person dealing in or owning slaves.

Profession.Name: Smith
Profession.Description: A person who works in metal.

Profession.Name: Soldier
Profession.Description: A person who serves in an army.

Profession.Name: Sorcerer/Sorceress
Profession.Description: A person who has magic powers.

Profession.Name: Spice Merchant
Profession.Description: A person involved in the spice trade.

Profession.Name: Squire
Profession.Description: A person of high social standing who owns and lives on an estate in a rural area, especially the chief landowner in such an area.

Profession.Name: Stable Hand
Profession.Description: A person who is responsible for some or all aspects of the management of horses and/or the care of the stables themselves.

Profession.Name: Storyteller
Profession.Description: A person who tells stories.

Profession.Name: Steward
Profession.Description: A person who looks after the passengers on a ship and brings them meals.

Profession.Name: Street Kid
Profession.Description: A youth who is homeless and lives on the streets.

Profession.Name: Surveyor
Profession.Description: A person who surveys, especially one whose profession is the surveying of land.

Profession.Name: Swineherd
Profession.Description: A person who tends pigs.

Profession.Name: Swordsman
Profession.Description: A person who fights with a sword (typically with his level of skill specified).

Profession.Name: Sycophant
Profession.Description: A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage.

Profession.Name: Tailor
Profession.Description: A person who makes fitted clothes such as shirts, pants, and jackets to fit individual customers.

Profession.Name: Tanner
Profession.Description: A person who tans animal hides.

Profession.Name: Tavern Keeper
Profession.Description: A person who is the keeper of a public house.

Profession.Name: Tax Collector
Profession.Description: A person who collects unpaid taxes from other people or corporations.

Profession.Name: Teamster
Profession.Description: A driver of a team of animals.

Profession.Name: Thatcher
Profession.Description: A person who thatches.

Profession.Name: Thief
Profession.Description: A person who steals another person's property, especially by stealth and without using force or violence.

Profession.Name: Tinker
Profession.Description: A person who travels from place to place mending metal utensils as a way of making a living.

Profession.Name: Torturer
Profession.Description: A person who inflicts severe pain on someone as a punishment or in order to force them to do or say something.

Profession.Name: Town Crier
Profession.Description: A person employed to make public announcements in the streets or marketplace of a town.

Profession.Name: Trader
Profession.Description: A person who buys and sells goods, currency, or stocks.

Profession.Name: Trapper
Profession.Description: A person who traps wild animals, especially for their fur.

Profession.Name: Vendor
Profession.Description: A person offering something for sale, especially a trader in the street.

Profession.Name: Vermin Catcher
Profession.Description: A person who practices vermin-catching as a professional form of pest control.

Profession.Name: Village Chief
Profession.Description: A person appointed to administer an area that is often a single village.

Profession.Name: Vintner
Profession.Description: A wine maker.

Profession.Name: Viking
Profession.Description: A person who is a seafaring pirate and trader that raids and settles in many parts of the world.

Profession.Name: Warlock
Profession.Description: A man who practices witchcraft.

Profession.Name: Warrior
Profession.Description: A brave or experienced soldier or fighter.

Profession.Name: Water Carrier
Profession.Description: A carrier of goods or people using the sea or waterways in transportation.

Profession.Name: Weaponsmith
Profession.Description: A person who makes weapons.

Profession.Name: Weaver
Profession.Description: A person who weaves fabric.

Profession.Name: Wet Nurse
Profession.Description: A woman employed to suckle another woman's child.

Profession.Name: Wine Seller
Profession.Description: A wine merchant.

Profession.Name: Witch
Profession.Description: A woman thought to have magic powers, especially evil ones.

Profession.Name: Wizard
Profession.Description: A man who has magical powers.

Profession.Name: Woodcarver
Profession.Description: A person whose occupation is woodcarving.

Profession.Name: Woodcutter
Profession.Description: A person who cuts down trees or branches.

Profession.Name: Wood Seller
Profession.Description: A person who specializes in the sale and distribution of wood.
